I move here and became a close political advisor to the United States. I learned all that stuff from American president Bush. I brought this up to him, and he agrees. But, if a country launched a missle, we would launch a counter offensive with nuclear weapons and wipe the country out. China and Russia, one missle, we launch a dozen back, and invade with an air assault and a shitload of naval ships carrying tamahawks and cruise missles towards their bases and cities. Then we would invade with some troops, and stuff.
 -John Milosevic

I think I have to echo Mr Milosevic`s question here. Why would this war break out? 
 
 For dominance on the international scene? That would be such a Pyrhus victory that regardless who won, it would not be worth it. 
 
 For oil? Both Russia and Iran are huge producers of oil, as is the US (even though it is a net-importer). Oil will also eventually be replaced, and while this will surely carry significant economic challanges, it will not be more so than a full scale war with other nuclear powers that are evenly matched. 
 
 For ideological reasons? Russia is ruled by a madman, but he is a very clever and pragmatic madman. He is concerned with his own power and certainly not chasing some dream of a peaceful and ideal world. The chinese are very pragmatic and unless there is some drastic regime change, unlikely to make rash decissions for no apparant benefits. That leaves India and the US, and I`m convinced that even these countries will not go to war with an evenly matched enemy without some dramatic social and political change. I just don`t see any of these things happening, and even if they do, it is very questionable that they will play out in a way that will lead to another world war. These social and political uppheavals are impossible to predict how they will play out, so don`t even bother is my advice :)
 
 For domestic political reasons? This is the only factor I think could be strong enough to cause a world war. Politicians are pre-dominantly interested in retaining and securing power. That doesn`t mean that they are cruel, imoral or doesn`t care about political issues, but it is a pre-requisite for them to pursue what they believe in as well as the source of the utility they gain from their position. But that would still mean that the domestic political and social climate in the US and India has changed so dramaticly that a suicide war would be thinkable. Putin doesn`t need to wage wars to secure his position. The chinese and iranian governments might, but there are much more viable options than launching a world war.
 
 I simply don`t think it will come to pass. Another world war cannot be predicted as it requires so many factors to come into line at the same time. The cold war was the closest we came to predicting a world war, and you all know how that one played out.
